metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3135 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the xt_alloc_table_info function in net/netfilter/x_tables.c in the Linux kernel through 4.5.2 on 32-bit platforms allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) via an IPT_SO_SET_REPLACE setsockopt call. Ben Hawkes discovered an integer overflow in the Linux netfilter implementation. On systems running 32 bit kernels, a local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code with administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-34-generic - 4.4.0-34.53
linux-image-4.4.0-34-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-34.53
linux-image-4.4.0-34-lowlatency - 4.4.0-34.53
linux-image-4.4.0-34-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-34.53
linux-image-4.4.0-34-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-34.53
linux-image-4.4.0-34-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-34.53
linux-image-4.4.0-34-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-34.53
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-34-generic - 4.4.0-34.53
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> possibly introduced with 711bdde6a884354ddae8da2fcb495b2a9364cc90 affects 4.2 and newer

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-34.53').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1019.25').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-34.53').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1022.25').
